p: The COVID-19 pandemic has brought to the forefront once again the importance of NCD prevalence and control as cofactors of morbidity and mortality in conjunction with infectious diseases. Mexico has among the highest rates of CKD and diabetes in the world, yet persons living with diabetes are usually diagnose late, and most remain outside the boundaries of effective coverage of best practices and hence most suffer uncontrolled diabetes exposing them to complications ( 11).
